description:
18.29 showwaves
Convert input audio to a video output, representing the samples waves.

The filter accepts the following options:
name: showwaves

options.description: Specify the video size for the output. For the syntax of this option, check the (ffmpeg-utils)"Video size" section in the ffmpeg-utils manual. Default value is 600x240.
options.name: size

options.description:
Set display mode.

Available values are:

‘point’

Draw a point for each sample.

‘line’

Draw a vertical line for each sample.

‘p2p’

Draw a point for each sample and a line between them.

‘cline’

Draw a centered vertical line for each sample.

Default value is point.
options.name: mode

options.description: Set the number of samples which are printed on the same column. A larger value will decrease the frame rate. Must be a positive integer. This option can be set only if the value for rate is not explicitly specified.
options.name: n

options.description: Set the (approximate) output frame rate. This is done by setting the option n. Default value is "25".
options.name: rate

options.description: Set if channels should be drawn separately or overlap. Default value is 0.
options.name: split_channels

options.description: Set colors separated by ’|’ which are going to be used for drawing of each channel.
options.name: colors

options.description:
Set amplitude scale.

Available values are:

‘lin’

Linear.

‘log’

Logarithmic.

‘sqrt’

Square root.

‘cbrt’

Cubic root.

Default is linear.
options.name: scale

choices.help: scale pixel values for each drawn sample
choices.name: scale

choices.help: draw every pixel for sample directly
choices.name: full

options.description:
Set the draw mode. This is mostly useful to set for high n.

Available values are:

‘scale’

Scale pixel values for each drawn sample.

‘full’

Draw every sample directly.

Default value is scale.
options.name: draw
